NeatGenome
IGenome
public
NeatGenome​<T>
where T : struct

Represents a NEAT genome, i.e the genetic representation of a neural network.

Type Parameter
T

Neural net numeric data type.

Properties
Id
public int Id { get }

Genome ID.

BirthGeneration
public int BirthGeneration { get }
FitnessInfo
public FitnessInfo FitnessInfo { get; set }

Genome fitness info.

Complexity
public double Complexity { get }

Gets a value that is representative of the genome's complexity.

For a NEAT genome we take the number of connections as representative of genome complexity.

MetaNeatGenome
public MetaNeatGenome<T> MetaNeatGenome { get }

Genome metadata.

ConnectionGenes
public ConnectionGenes<T> ConnectionGenes { get }

Connection genes data structure.  These define both the neural network structure/topology and the connection weights.

HiddenNodeIdArray
public int[] HiddenNodeIdArray { get }

An array of hidden node IDs, sorted to allow efficient lookup of an ID with a binary search.  Input and output node IDs are not included because these are allocated fixed IDs starting from zero and are therefore always known.

NodeIndexByIdMap
public INodeIdMap NodeIndexByIdMap { get }

Mapping function for obtaining a node index for a given node ID.

Node indexes have a range of 0 to N-1 (for N nodes), i.e. the indexes are zero based and contiguous; as opposed to node IDs, which are not contiguous.

DirectedGraph
public DirectedGraph DirectedGraph { get }

The directed graph that the current genome represents.

This digraph mirrors the graph described by ConnectionGenes; this object represents the graph structure only, not the weights, and is therefore re-used when spawning genomes with the same structure (i.e. a child that is the result of connection weight mutations only).  The DirectedGraph class provides an efficient means of working with graphs and is therefore made available on this class to provide improved performance for: * Decoding to a neural net object.  * Finding new connections on acyclic graphs, i.e. detecting if a random new connection would form a cycle.  Note. When MetaNeatGenome.IsAcyclic is true then the object stored here will be of the subtype Graphs.Acyclic.DirectedGraphAcyclic .

Functions
ContainsHiddenNode
public bool ContainsHiddenNode(
int id
)

Tests if the genome contains a connection that refers to the given hidden node ID.

Parameter
id
int

Node ID.

Returns

True if the genome contains a hidden node with the specified ID; otherwise false.

GetDigraphWeightArray
public T[] GetDigraphWeightArray()

Gets an array of connection weights, ordered to match the connections of DirectedGraph.

For cyclic genomes this is simply the genome's weight array, but for acyclic genomes the digraph and genome represent connections in a different order, thus for acyclic genomes/digraphs this method will return a new array with the weights in the digraph order.

Returns

An array of connection weights.
